title: McDonald's on Pace for Largest Percent Decrease in Over a Year — Data Talk
text:
McDonald's Corporation (MCD) is currently at $200.53, down $9.32 or 4.44%

-- Would be the lowest close since June 5, 2019, when it closed at $200.13

-- On pace for largest percent decrease since March 2, 2018, when it fell 4.77%

-- Earlier Tuesday, McDonald's reported that third-quarter earnings of $1.6 billion were down 2% from a year earlier when accounting for currency fluctuations. The company reported earnings per share of $2.11 and sales of $5.4 billion. Analysts polled by FactSet expected earnings per share of $2.21 adjusting for one-time items, and $5.5 billion in sales

-- Down 6.6% month-to-date

-- Up 12.93% year-to-date; on pace for best year since 2017, when it rose 41.41%

-- Down 9.32% from its all-time closing high of $221.15 on Aug. 9, 2019

-- Up 13.2% from 52 weeks ago (Oct. 23, 2018), when it closed at $177.15

-- Down 9.32% from its 52 week closing high of $221.15 on Aug. 9, 2019

-- Up 17.76% from its 52 week closing low of $170.28 on Dec. 24, 2018

-- Second worst performer in the DJIA today

-- Fourth worst performer in the S&P 500 today

-- Subtracted 63.19 points from the DJIA so far today

All data as of 2:11:08 PM

Source: Dow Jones Market Data, FactSet

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 22, 2019 14:37 ET (18:37 GMT)
